intro: Hieracium subprolixiforme, commonly known as the long-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular-dotted. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subprolixiforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
